snippet: The Olympics were seen as a triumph by many in Brazil, and some of the worst fears were shown to be unfounded. But political polarization and economic and security concerns linger....
abstract: Spectacular closing ceremony marks end of Rio Olympics; Games are largely seen as success for city and for Brazil, although political, economic and safety concerns still linger.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and ANDREW JACOBS
byline.contributor: Paula Moura and Anna Jean Kaiser contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Olympics were seen as a triumph by many in Brazil, and some of the worst fears were shown to be unfounded. But political polarization and economic and security concerns linger.

headline.main: As Games End, Rio Celebrates While Looking Warily to Future
headline.print_headline: With Future Cloudy, Rain Falls on Rio Party
